intro: Dontospermum lanzarotense, commonly known as the Lanzarote sea holly, is a unique succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that form a dense rosette. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in coastal environments, tolerating saline conditions and rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
